blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

summary: I want them to use Gentle Repose to preserve Molly’s body until they can figure out what to do which inevitably leads to...
body: I want them to use Gentle Repose to preserve Molly’s body until they can figure out what to do which inevitably leads to shenanigans when they run into other people and have to act like they aren’t carrying a dead body around because that looks mega suspicious. Options include clever ventriloquism, moving his limbs around like a puppet and trying to convince people that Molly’s ‘just resting’ like the Monty Python Dead Parrot skit.

summary: ...I just looked up Cone of Cold and that’s a fucking fifth level spell so not only were the Mighty Nein outnumbered, they were...
body:
…I just looked up Cone of Cold and that’s a fucking fifth level spell so not only were the Mighty Nein outnumbered, they were outnumbered against people who had access to fifth level spells which - and this is a fact I have cause to know very well - makes them at least Level 9, assuming that wasn’t a fucking racial ability of Lorenzo’s, which would be obscene.

There was no way they were winning that fight and if Molly doesn’t at least get a chance at a resurrection ritual, I call so much bullshit.

I have to believe that Matt would at least give Molly that much given that he died against a group almost literally twice as powerful as the M9 that they weren’t supposed to be fighting yet anyway because Travis and Laura weren’t ready to come back.

This show is better than killing off characters for good for bullshit reasons. I have to believe that.

blog.name: yashathefallen
blog.title: We are not things
blog.description: Julia . 24 . Fiction Enthusiast . Marvel, Mad Max, Wonder Woman, Gaming, Critical Role, and also cats. And social justice. And feminism. Also JESSICA JONES. Formerly jessicafuckingjones & brilliant-but-scary-bad-wolf “Jyn had turned to him from the control panel looking like the last survivor of a war, and she’d smiled in a way he’d never seen before. It hadn’t been a smile predicated on anticipation or courage, or one touched by sadness or doubt; just a smile so ordinary it seemed to change Jyn from a hero out of myth into a woman he might have known and understood."

summary: CRITICAL ROLE SPOILERS
body:
CRITICAL ROLE SPOILERS

Okay, so here’s my Fix-It headcanon.

Lucien was cursed to be immortal. Every time he resurrects, he does so with amnesia, so that karma can inflict maximum damage upon him as an innocent. Because he himself destroyed so many innocents.

Whoever cursed him either wants to inflict maximum karmic damage, or wants to see if he can erase that bad karma throughout a number of good Resurrection Cycles. Or perhaps a combination of the both.

Que a set-up for Molly to be found wandering on the side of the road when the M9 return from their latest mission.

tags: also thats what Molly gets for saying the The Traveler is bullshit
summary: In regards to last nights episode, I’m sorry but characters permanently die in Dungeons and Dragons all the time. It is...
body:
In regards to last nights episode, I’m sorry but characters permanently die in Dungeons and Dragons all the time. It is literally part of the game. I’m sorry that people are sad and really liked Molly. But, the fact that Vox Machina “survived” their entire campaign was a miracle granted by a very lenient DM that home brewed rules for character death.

I feel like people are expecting Matt to go into Talks and apologize. But, in all likelyhood he’s going to explain how that is a real aspect of the game and how he (like MANY DMs) is excited to see how the party reacts to this and how it shows real consequences to both the characters and players.

All of the cast members (aside from Sam) are seasoned DND players that are aware of this. They accept it. Honestly, talesin didn’t seem that upset by it. Which isn’t because he didn’t like Molly but because he was playing a character that didn’t think about consequences and Tal knew that his death was a very real possibility. I mean Molly was just as likely to accidentally overdose or stumble into the Faewild by accident.

I’m sorry that people are hurting. But, Talesin isn’t gone and if they can’t bring Molly back then he’ll role up another character that you’ll learn to love.
